intro: Dasiphora phyllocalyx, commonly known as the Indian paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and bright, often red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and prairies. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, with each leaflet being ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its role in supporting pollinators.
